byline.contributor: Julia Werdigier contributed reporting from London.

abstract: Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell, two largest oil companies in United States and Europe, report robust profits for third quarter based on higher oil prices and better refining margins; Exxon profit is $10.33 billion, and Shell profit is $6.98 billion.
snippet: The two largest oil companies in the United States and in Europe reported strong earnings for the third quarter.
lead_paragraph: The two largest oil companies in the United States and in Europe reported strong earnings for the third quarter.

headline.main: Oil Industry Hums as Higher Prices Bolster Quarterly Profits at Exxon and Shell
headline.print_headline: Oil Industry Hums as Higher Prices Bolster Quarterly Profits at Exxon and Shell
headline.seo: Higher Oil Prices Lift Profits at Exxon and Shell
